fields.name: mirna_db
fields.label: The name of the miRNA database used, chosen from the DCC's codelist

fields.name: mirna_id
fields.label: The miRNA accession ID in the chosen miRNA database. Use -777 when miRNA detected does not exist in the miRNA db, i.e., a possibly novel miRNA

config.script: if (mirna_db != '-777' && mirna_db != '-888') { mirna_id != '-777' && mirna_id != '-888' } else { return false; }
config.description: If the reported miRNA is in a public miRNA database (mirna_db is not null), a miRNA accession ID (mirna_id) must be specified

fields.name: normalized_read_count
fields.label: Normalized read count for the current miRNA

fields.name: raw_read_count
fields.label: Raw read count for the current gene

fields.name: fold_change
fields.label: Gene expression fold change

fields.name: is_isomir
fields.label: A flag from a codelist that indicates if the current miRNA is an isomir, which is defined as having a variation with respect to the annotated annotated mature miRNA

fields.name: chromosome
fields.label: Name of the chromosome containing the miRNA. Do not fill when the detected miRNA is annotated in miRNA database

config.script: if (mirna_db != '-777' && mirna_db != '-888') { chromosome != '-777' && chromosome != '-888' } else if (mirna_db == '-777' || mirna_db == '-888') { chromosome == '-777' || chromosome == '-888' } else { return false }
config.description: If the detected miRNA is in a public miRNA Db (ie. mirna_db is not null), the chromosome number should not be filled in (use '-888'). However if the reported miRNA is not in miRNA DB, chromosome must be filled in

fields.name: chromosome_start
fields.label: Chromosome start position of the feature being described

config.description: If the detected miRNA is not in a public miRNA Db (ie. mirna_id and mirna_db are not provided), the chromosome start/end positions must be specified

fields.name: chromosome_end
fields.label: Chromosome end position of the feature being described

config.description: If the detected miRNA is not in a public miRNA Db (ie. mirna_id and mirna_db are not provided), the chromosome start/end positions must be specified. Chromosome end position must be less than or equal to the length of the chromosome

fields.name: chromosome_strand
fields.label: Chromosome strand of the feature being described.

config.script: if ( (mirna_db == '-777' || mirna_db == '-888') && (mirna_id == '-777' || mirna_id == '-888') ) { if ((chromosome_strand == '-777') || (chromosome_strand == '-888')) { return false } else { return true } } else { return true }
config.description: If the detected miRNA is not in a public miRNA Db (ie. mirna_id and mirna_db are not provided), the chromosome strand needs to be specified

fields.name: chromosome_start
fields.label: Chromosome start position of the feature being described

config.script: lengths = ['1':249250621, '2':243199373, '3':198022430, '4':191154276, '5':180915260, '6':171115067, '7':159138663, '8':146364022, '9':141213431, '10':135534747, '11':135006516, '12':133851895, '13':115169878, '14':107349540, '15':102531392, '16':90354753, '17':81195210, '18':78077248, '19':59128983, '20':63025520, '21':48129895, '22':51304566, 'X':155270560, 'Y':59373566, 'MT':16569]; mismatch = (variant_type == '1'); insertion = (variant_type == '2'); deletion = (variant_type == '3'); multiple_base_substitution = (variant_type == '4'); if (!(chromosome_start >= 1 && chromosome_end <= lengths[chromosome] && chromosome_start <= chromosome_end)) { return false } if (mismatch || insertion) {chromosome_start == chromosome_end } else if (deletion || multiple_base_substitution) { chromosome_end - chromosome_start + 1 <= 200 } else { return false }
config.description: Chromosome start position must be less than or equal to the chromosome end position. If single-base substution or insertion, the chromosome start position must equal the chromosome end position. If variant is a deletion or multiple-base substitution, then the difference between the chromosome end and start position must be less than or equal to 200.

fields.name: chromosome_end
fields.label: Chromosome end position of the feature being described

config.script: lengths = ['1':249250621, '2':243199373, '3':198022430, '4':191154276, '5':180915260, '6':171115067, '7':159138663, '8':146364022, '9':141213431, '10':135534747, '11':135006516, '12':133851895, '13':115169878, '14':107349540, '15':102531392, '16':90354753, '17':81195210, '18':78077248, '19':59128983, '20':63025520, '21':48129895, '22':51304566, 'X':155270560, 'Y':59373566, 'MT':16569]; mismatch = (variant_type == '1'); insertion = (variant_type == '2'); deletion = (variant_type == '3'); multiple_base_substitution = (variant_type == '4'); if (!(chromosome_start >= 1 && chromosome_end <= lengths[chromosome] && chromosome_start <= chromosome_end)) { return false } if (mismatch || insertion) {chromosome_start == chromosome_end } else if (deletion || multiple_base_substitution) { chromosome_end - chromosome_start + 1 <= 200 } else { return false }
config.description: Chromosome end position must be less than or equal to the chromosome length. If single-base substution or insertion, the chromosome start position must equal the chromosome end position. If variant is a deletion or multiple-base substitution, then the difference between the chromosome end and start position must be less than or equal to 200.

fields.name: chromosome_strand
fields.label: Chromosome strand of mutation. Must always use forward strand (1)

fields.name: reference_genome_allele
fields.label: Allele in the reference genome. For insertions, use a dash sign for a missing base. For all other types of variations, use forward strand DNA sequence at the reference genome position as specified in chromosome, chromosome_start and chromosome_end

fields.name: genotype
fields.label: Genotype of the control sample. Use a dash for each missing allele.

fields.name: variant_allele
fields.label: The allele in genotype that is different from reference_genome_allele

config.script: mismatch = (variant_type == '1'); insertion = (variant_type == '2'); deletion = (variant_type == '3'); multiple_base_substitution = (variant_type == '4'); length_of_variant_allele = variant_allele.length(); length_of_reference_genome_allele = reference_genome_allele.length(); genotypeAlleles = genotype.split('/'); if (!(genotypeAlleles contains variant_allele)) { return false } if (deletion && (variant_allele != '-')) { return false } if ( (mismatch || insertion || multiple_base_substitution) && !(variant_allele ~='[ACTG]+') ) { return false } if (mismatch && length_of_variant_allele != 1) { return false } if ( (insertion || multiple_base_substitution) && (length_of_variant_allele < 1 || length_of_variant_allele > 200) ){ return false } if (multiple_base_substitution) { !(length_of_variant_allele == 1 && length_of_reference_genome_allele == 1) } if (variant_allele == reference_genome_allele) { return false } return true
config.description: The allele in this field must be one of the alleles defined in genotype field. If variation is a deletion, the allele must be represented as a dash. Otherwise, for all other variations, the allele must be represented as either A,C,T or G. For a mismatch mutation, only one base must be provided. For insertions and multiple base substitutions, the length of the variant_allele must be between 1-200. If variatio is a multiple base substitution, the length of variant_allele and reference_genome_allele cannot both be 1. The allele specified in variant_allele must not be the same as the allele specified in reference_genome_allele

config.script: if (variant_allele_read_count == null || total_read_count == null) { return true } else { variant_allele_read_count <= total_read_count }
config.description: The value for variant allele read count must be less than the value for total read count

config.script: ctrlAlleles = control_genotype.split('/'); if (!(ctrlAlleles contains mutated_from_allele)) { return false } else { return true; }
config.description: One of the alleles in control_genotype must match the allele specified in mutat/ed_from_allele

fields.name: mutated_from_allele
fields.label: Allele that is believed to be the original allele in the ancestral cell that was mutated in the tumour cell. Use dash for insertions. Mutated allele must be one of the two alleles in the control_genotype

config.script: mismatch = (mutation_type == '1'); insertion = (mutation_type == '2'); deletion = (mutation_type == '3'); multiple_base_substitution = (mutation_type == '4'); length_of_mutated_from_allele = mutated_from_allele.length(); length_of_mutated_to_allele = mutated_to_allele.length(); ctrlAlleles = control_genotype.split('/'); if (!(ctrlAlleles contains mutated_from_allele)) {return false } if (insertion && (mutated_from_allele != '-'))  { return false } if ( (mismatch || deletion || multiple_base_substitution) && !(mutated_from_allele ~='[ACTG]+') ) { return false } if (mismatch && length_of_mutated_from_allele != 1) { return false } if ( (deletion || multiple_base_substitution) && (length_of_mutated_from_allele < 1 || length_of_mutated_from_allele > 200) ) { return false } if (multiple_base_substitution) { !(length_of_mutated_from_allele == 1 && length_of_mutated_to_allele == 1) } return true
config.description: The allele in this field must be one of the alleles defined in control_genotype. If mutation is an insertion, the allele must be represented as a dash (-). Otherwise, for all other mutations, the allele must be represented as either A,C,T or G. For a mismatch mutation, only one base must be provided. For deletions and multiple base substitutions, the length of the mutated_from_allele must be between 1-200. If mutation is a multiple base substitution, the length of mutated_from_allele and mutated_to_allele cannot both be 1

fields.name: mutated_to_allele
fields.label: The new allele identified in the tumour sample that is believed to be the resulting allele of a somatic mutation event during tumourgenesis. Use dash for deletions. Mutant allele must be one allele and must be one of the alleles defined in tumour_genotype

config.script: mismatch = (mutation_type == '1'); insertion = (mutation_type == '2'); deletion = (mutation_type == '3'); multiple_base_substitution = (mutation_type == '4'); length_of_mutated_from_allele = mutated_from_allele.length(); length_of_mutated_to_allele = mutated_to_allele.length(); tumourAlleles = tumour_genotype.split('/'); ctrlAlleles = control_genotype.split('/'); if (!(tumourAlleles contains mutated_to_allele)) { return false } var allele = null; for (allele:tumourAlleles) { if (!(ctrlAlleles contains allele)) { if (mutated_to_allele != allele) { return false } } } if (deletion && (mutated_to_allele != '-')) { return false } if ( (mismatch || insertion || multiple_base_substitution) && !(mutated_to_allele ~='[ACTG]+') ) { return false } if (mismatch && length_of_mutated_to_allele != 1) { return false } if ( (insertion || multiple_base_substitution) && (length_of_mutated_to_allele < 1 || length_of_mutated_to_allele > 200) ){ return false } if (multiple_base_substitution) { !(length_of_mutated_from_allele == 1 && length_of_mutated_to_allele == 1) } return true
config.description: The allele in this field must be one of the alleles defined in tumour_genotype. If mutation is a deletion, the allele must be represented as a dash (-). Otherwise, for all other mutations, the allele must be represented as either A,C,T or G. For a mismatch mutation, only one base must be provided. For insertions and multiple base substitutions, the length of the mutated_to_allele must be between 1-200. If mutation is a multiple base substitution, the length of mutated_from_allele and mutated_to_allele cannot both be 1

fields.name: tumour_genotype
fields.label: Genotype of the tumour sample. Use a dash for each missing base

config.script: tumourAlleles = tumour_genotype.split('/'); (tumourAlleles contains mutated_to_allele)
config.description: Use a dash for a missing base. Must be a string consisting of two or more aleles joined by a forward slash. No whitespace allowed, and each allele must consist of either A, C, T, G or -. One of the alleles must exist in mutated_to_allele.

fields.name: expressed_allele
fields.label: For heterozygous SNPs, the dominant allele as revealed by RNA-seq in the tumour sample. When multiple alleles are identified, up to four alleles can be specified, each separated by a comma (no whitespace allowed)

fields.label: Quality score of the mutation call

config.script: if (mutant_allele_read_count == null || total_read_count == null) { return true } else { mutant_allele_read_count <= total_read_count }
config.description: The value for mutant allele read count must be less than the value for total read count

fields.name: verification_status
fields.label: Indicate if the mutation/variation has been verified using an independent orthogonal genotype platform/technology

fields.name: verification_platform
fields.label: Identifier of orthogonal platform or technology used to confirm that the mutation/variant is true; identifier should be taken from controlled vocabulary list of platforms recognized by the DCC and should directly correspond to the particular technology (including version) used. If no appropriate term exists for a given platform, please contact the DCC to request an addition to the CV terms.

config.script: if (verification_status == '1' && verification_platform == null ) { return false } else { return true }
config.description: If mutation is verified, the verification platform must be specified (cannot be -777/-888)

fields.name: biological_validation_status
fields.label: Indicate if the mutation/variation has been observed in a larger cohort/sample size, and is not an artifact or consequence of sample selection for sequencing

fields.name: biological_validation_platform
fields.label: Identifier of assay platform or technology used to validate the mutation/variant

config.script: if (biological_validation_status == '1') { biological_validation_platform != '-777' && biological_validation_platform != '-888' } else { return true }
config.description: If mutation is biologically validated, the biological validation platform must be specified

fields.label: Indicate if sample is part of a study

fields.name: donor_id
fields.label: Unique identifier for the donor; assigned by data provider. It must be coded, and correspond to a donor ID listed in the donor data file.

fields.name: specimen_id
fields.label: Unique identifier for a collected specimen assigned by data provider.

fields.name: specimen_type
fields.label: Controlled vocabulary description of specimen type.

fields.name: specimen_type_other
fields.label: Free text description of site of specimen if 'normal control (other)' or 'tumour (other)' was specified in specimen_type field.

fields.name: specimen_interval
fields.label: Interval between primary diagnosis and specimen acquisition, in days

fields.name: specimen_donor_treatment_type
fields.label: Type of treatment the donor received prior to specimen acquisition.

fields.name: specimen_donor_treatment_type_other
fields.label: If 'other' therapy indicated in previous column, describe it here. eg: molecular

fields.name: specimen_processing
fields.label: Description of technique used to process specimen

fields.name: specimen_processing_other
fields.label: If 'other' specified for specimen_processing, may indicate technique here.

fields.name: specimen_storage
fields.label: Description of how specimen was stored. For specimens that were extracted freshly or immediately cultured, answer (1) 'NA'.

fields.name: specimen_storage_other
fields.label: If 'other' specified for specimen_storage, may indicate technique here.

fields.name: tumour_confirmed
fields.label: Whether tumour was confirmed in the specimen by histological examination.

fields.name: specimen_biobank
fields.label: If the specimen was obtained from a biobank, provide the biobank name here

fields.name: specimen_biobank_id
fields.label: If the specimen was obtained from a biobank, provide the biobank accession number here.

fields.name: specimen_available
fields.label: Whether additional tissue is available for followup studies.

fields.name: tumour_histological_type
fields.label: 'WHO International Histological Classification of Tumours' code. See http://w2.iarc.fr/en/publications/pdfs-online/pat-gen/bb2/BB2.pdf for details.

fields.name: tumour_grading_system
fields.label: Name of tumour grading system

fields.name: tumour_grade
fields.label: Tumour grade using indicated grading system

fields.name: tumour_grade_supplemental
fields.label: Optional additional grading provided as a comma-delimited list of 'grading system:grade'

fields.name: tumour_stage_system
fields.label: Name of tumour staging system used

fields.name: tumour_stage
fields.label: Pathological tumour stage value using indicated staging system

fields.name: tumour_stage_supplemental
fields.label: Optional additional staging provided as a comma-delimited list of 'staging system:stage'

fields.name: digital_image_of_stained_section
fields.label: Linkout(s) to digital image of a stained section, demonstrating a representative section of tumour

fields.name: percentage_cellularity
fields.label: The ratio of tumour nuclei to total number of nuclei in a given specimen expressed as a percentage. Can populate information in either this field or level_of_cellularity

fields.name: level_of_cellularity
fields.label: The proportion of tumour nuclei to total number of nuclei in a given specimen. If exact percentage cellularity cannot be determined submitter has option to use this field to specify a level that defines a range of percentage.

fields.name: specimen_notes
fields.label: Free text notes allowed

fields.name: donor_id
fields.label: Unique identifier for the donor; assigned by data provider. It must be coded, and correspond to a donor ID listed in the donor data file.

fields.name: procedure_interval
fields.label: Interval between primary diagnosis and procedure, in days

fields.name: procedure_type
fields.label: Controlled vocabulary description of the procedure type. Vocabulary can be extended by disease-specific projects. Prefix extensions with 3-digit center code, e.g. 008.1 Beijing Cancer Hospital, fine needle aspiration of primary

fields.name: procedure_site
fields.label: Anatomical site of the procedure. This must use a standard controlled vocabulary which should be reported in advance to the DCC.

fields.name: resection_status
fields.label: For resection procedures, an indication of the extent of residual disease.

fields.name: specimen_id
fields.label: ID of ICGC specimen resulting from procedure. If present, must match specimen_id in specimen data file.

fields.name: donor_id
fields.label: Unique identifier for the donor; assigned by data provider. It must be coded, and correspond to a donor ID listed in the donor data file.

fields.name: therapy_start_interval
fields.label: Interval between primary diagnosis and initiation of therapy, in days

fields.name: therapy_duration
fields.label: Duration of therapy, in days

fields.name: therapy_type
fields.label: Name of therapy

fields.name: therapy_response
fields.label: What was the clinical effect of the therapy?

fields.name: therapy_notes
fields.label: Further description of therapy, such as dosing schedule.
